Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra smashed rapid unbeaten centuries to set up New Zealand's successful pursuit of a 283-run victory target, which came with 13.4 overs to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler indicated that while the loss hurt he was not too concerned, saying 'We were very much outplayed by New Zealand and it is a tough defeat to take, but it is still one loss at the start of a long tournament and we won't get too down on ourselves.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: All 11 England batters made double figures — the first time any side have managed that in ODIs — but it was a patchy batting display overall.
New Zealand lost Will Young for nought in the first over but Conway, who made a career-best 152 not out, and Ravindra immediately turned the heat back on England with their free scoring.
